item.title: Floods: Research shows millions more at risk of flooding
item.description: Numbers of people exposed to flooding globally have risen by almost a quarter in two decades.

item.title: Keir Starmer attacks government record on green jobs
item.description: The Labour leader says there is a "chasm between soundbites and action" on climate-friendly employment.

item.title: Thailand bans coral-damaging sunscreens in marine parks
item.description: Anyone flouting the rules could be fined due to the damage some lotions can cause to coral.

item.title: COP26 'should be hybrid event' says former climate chief Figueres
item.description: The main architect of Paris Agreement says the summit will need to be a mix of virtual and in-person meetings.

item.title: Timber shortage due to 'unprecedented' post-lockdown demand
item.description: Prices are rising sharply as climate change and post-lockdown DIY and building projects hit supplies.

item.title: Climate change: Wales set to build 20,000 low-carbon social homes
item.description: Welsh ministers announce plans to tackle a housing shortage and the problem of climate change.

item.title: Finance firms plan to close coal plants in Asia
item.description: The Asian Development Bank aims to have the plan ready for the COP26 climate conference in November.

item.title: Then and now: The burning issue of wildfires
item.description: Scientists are increasingly concerned climate change is making fires more frequent and more intense.

item.title: Electric car charging prices 'must be fair' say MPs
item.description: Consumers should not have to pay excessive prices to use public car charging, MPs say.

item.title: UK already undergoing disruptive climate change
item.description: Last year was the third warmest, fifth wettest and eighth sunniest on record in the UK, scientists warn.

item.title: COP26 climate summit president says progress made, but not enough
item.description: The first in-person climate meeting in 18 months sees some tentative progress, but no breakthroughs.

item.title: Iran water: What's causing the shortages?
item.description: Iranian officials have warned of historic drought while experts blame years of poor water management.

item.title: 'Most powerful' tidal turbine starts generating electricity off Orkney
item.description: The Orbital O2, which is anchored off Orkney, has the capacity to meet the annual power demand of 2,000 homes.

item.title: Climate change: Researchers begin discussions on vital report
item.description: A two-week virtual negotiation begins on the most critical climate change report since 2013.

item.title: Extreme weather: What causes flash flooding?
item.description: Cities across the world are at risk of extreme rainfall overwhelming their streets

item.title: UK military opens first space command centre
item.description: The new operations centre will help the UK maintain a "battle-winning advantage", ministers say.

item.title: Boeing's Starliner spacecraft: A guide
item.description: Starliner is one of two vehicles designed to transport astronauts to and from the space station.

item.title: Russian module mishap destabilises International Space Station
item.description: The ISS was pushed out of position after engines on a new Russian module unexpectedly fired up.

item.title: Bezos' $2bn offer to get back in race to the Moon
item.description: The billionaire offers to cover $2bn in Nasa costs to be reconsidered for a Moon lander contract.

item.title: The fungus and bacteria tackling plastic waste
item.description: Bacteria, fungus and enzymes can all digest plastic, but can they work at a useful commercial scale?

item.title: Finding answers to the world's drinking water crisis
item.description: Scientists are racing to come up with technologies that can solve the world's clean water shortage.

item.title: The new surgical tool inspired by a wasp
item.description: The device avoids clogging by using friction instead of suction, similar to the way a parasitoid wasp lays its eggs.

item.title: Is there a future for Africa's lions?
item.description: As lion populations decline across much of Africa, could community-led conservation help reverse this trend?

item.title: AI breakthrough could spark medical revolution
item.description: A program has been used to predict the structures of nearly every protein in the human body.

item.title: Virgin Galactic: Richard Branson's long, winding path to space
item.description: The BBC tracks the long, winding road to Sir Richard Branson's flight to the edge of space.

item.title: 'Jurassic Pompeii' yields thousands of 'squiggly wiggly' fossils
item.description: Scientists are excavating one of the most important Jurassic sites ever discovered in the UK.
